metadata.title: CVE-2015-8366 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
Array index error in smal_decode_segment function in LibRaw before 0.17.1 allows context-dependent attackers to cause memory errors and possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors related to indexes.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2015-8366` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dcraw - 9.28-2
No subscription required

libraw-bin - 0.18.2-1
libraw20 - 0.18.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: darktable package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
dcraw package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.28-2').
exactimage package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
kodi package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
libraw package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.2-1').
rawtherapee package in impish is affected and needs fixing.
